column4: can anyone tell me why in the latest ubuntu i don't have the same level of flexibility in gnome desktop as in previous release and/or debian why can i put 2 panels on one side of the screen (one left other right)  or why do i have only 2 (instead of 4) workspaces
right click the 2 desktops and add more.
everything you mention i changed in the last 3 seconds
where is the "2 deskops" i should r-click on to add more ...
the applet that shows the mini desktops is in the lower right on my panel
got it
try dragging a panel across?
worked on mine
how do i grab ... the shit that's "on" the panel is taking up and overlaping the panel itself
ya gotta find a blank space to grab - it can be a challenge :)
btw, mentioning shit is frowned upon

check this out ... it worked but the problem is that since you cannot specify right/left the panels (if both not hidden) arrange on top of each other... they will though hide in 2 seperate corners BTW i guarantee you this was a feature taken out by ubuntu ppl to have "sensible defaults" as they put it ... BS i tell you BS
maybe - complain to them...
mine are side by side and both are not hidden
right click on the panels properties and tell me if both say the same orientation (ie "bottom")
yes - both say right
i made them different widths so i could tell them apart
which version of ubuntu are you using
this issue i am testing on 6.10
i swear to you i can't get them to be unhidden next to each other on the bottom only on top of each other
there may be a bug - maybe worth reporting.  for me, no since i do not like so many panels anyway
i do believe you - linux works in mysterious ways
well thanx for you help and testing ... i'll try to look for some help on gnome pages
seriously thanx
